intro: Chenopodium matthioli, commonly known as silverleaf goosefoot, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring succulent, silver-gray leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are borne on branched inflorescences. Its leaves are characterized by a dense covering of fine hairs, giving them a distinctive silvery appearance. Chenopodium matthioli thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
